etymologies: early 20th century. From the name of Alfred J. Moses, U.S. mineralogist + -ite

definitions: A cubic hydrated nitrogen compound of mercury (chemically, a salt of Millon's base) which occurs as yellow crystals and has the formula Hg₂ NX.H₂ O, where X represents chiefly chloride and sulphate (and sometimes also molybdate).
